pages.title: Entry 1
pages.text: Elena flagged the resonance decay seven months ago. She showed me the data — a 0.003% drift in the orbital anchor frequency.$(br2)I told her it was within tolerance.$(br2)She looked at me like I'd said something unforgivable.$(br2)$(italic)She was right.$()

pages.title: Entry 2
pages.text: The decay isn't linear. It's $(bold)exponential.$()$(br2)I re-ran Elena's models with updated data. The curve isn't slowing down. It's accelerating.$(br2)The committee reviewed our findings and scheduled a follow-up meeting in $(bold)six months.$()$(br2)Six months.$(br)We don't have six months.

pages.title: Entry 3
pages.text: The cascade has begun. Node cluster 1400-1622 went offline simultaneously. The remaining nodes tried to compensate. Overcorrected. Triggered failures in the southern hemisphere array.$(br2)We are past the point of correction. Elena's math was right all along.$(br2)I owe her an apology.

pages.title: Entry 4
pages.text: Evacuation preparations are underway. Project Exodus. Fourteen billion people in seventy-two hours.$(br2)I've packed my notes and my grandmother's ring. There is nothing else worth saving from this office.$(br2)The numbers say this is irreversible. I've checked them nine times.

pages.title: Entry 5
pages.text: Kevin from Logistics says he's going back for one more surface sweep. Says he saw lights in a settlement to the east.$(br2)I told him the shuttles won't wait. He said he knows.$(br2)He took extra thermal blankets.$(br2)I didn't stop him. $(italic)I should have stopped him.$()

pages.title: Entry 6
pages.text: The shuttle launched twenty minutes ago.$(br2)Kevin isn't here.$(br2)Through the viewport I can see the dark side of Earth growing. The ice is visible from orbit now. Continents I used to know are white.$(br2)Somewhere down there, Kevin is still looking.$(br2)$(italic)— M.V.$()
